profile.title: Profile
profile.content: I'm an experienced software engineer that's worked with React, Ruby on Rails, and many other technologies in an enterprise setting. After spending college working with computational biology, I moved into web development and have never looked back. Along the way I've supplemented my programming knowledge with biology, mathematics, and various hobbies, giving me a broad range of experiences that I can apply to software development. I strive to not just get the job done, but to help improve the processes of the team I'm working with.

xceleration.companyDescription: Enterprise solutions for employee award programs
xceleration.jobDescription: Helped my team ship the latest version of RewardStation, a platform for enterprise clients to create their own, completely customized, employee incentive programs
jobDetails: Worked under under a variety of management conditions and structures to meet deadlines and fulfill business needs
Lead work on employee nominations, one of the two central points of the Rewardstation platform
Pushed code practices forward, including Redux selectors and improved Typescript practices

levvel.jobDescription: Worked with clients to create effective, maintainable software solutions addressing a wide array of needs, using any technology dictated by the client or the pre-existing codebase.
jobDetails: Gave users of an existing Ruby on Rails app the ability to plan out their sales for the upcoming financial year
Assisted in putting an authorization/permissions system over an already extensive Angular application
Worked with multiple teams using agile development and a variety of software design, testing, and code review systems

pcls.jobDescription: Responsible for a broad array of services within the QC department, including instrument maintenance and data analysis. Developed automation tools using Excel and VBA to increase department productivity.
jobDetails: Developed an automated QC chart system in Excel, which saved over 40 employee-hours per week by automatically extracting and plotting QC data.
Created a QC checklist that flagged failed controls, and removed all copy-pasting from the analysis process.
Worked with the rest of the QC team on instrument maintenance and calibration curve analysis, ensuring quality in production

unc.companyDescription: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
unc.jobDescription: Managed an independant research project, involving analysis of raw genotype data to meet the laboratory's broader research goals. Interwove SQL, Python, and R to produce meaningful statistics and visualizations from millions of data points.
jobDetails: Applied various statistical techniques and algorithms to raw data from the lab's SNP microarray
Created part of the computational suite required to turn this microarray into a toolkit for determining the subspecies of mixed wild mouse populations
